name: Banana Loaf Bread Recipe
description: Transform overripe bananas into delicious banana loaf bread. Incorporate your preferred mix-ins to make it your own.
keywords: banana loaf bread recipe, banana loaf bread, easy banana bread, moist banana loaf, homemade banana bread, beginner baking recipe, simple banana bread, overripe bananas recipe, what to do with ripe bananas, banana recipe, baking with ripe bananas, how to make banana loaf bread, banana bread with yogurt, banana bread secret ingredient, yogurt banana bread, yogurt loaf banana bread, moist banana bread loaf recipe, moist banana bread with yogurt, how to make moist banana bread, delicious banana bread loaf recipe, banana bread recipe, my favorite banana loaf bread recipe, best banana bread loaf recipe, moist banana bread recipe, best banana bread recipe, best banana bread loaf recipe
recipeIngredient: 6 oz package plain or vanilla yogurt (¾ cup)
¾ cup granulated white cane sugar
½ cup chocolate chips (optional; see notes)
recipeInstructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F. Line a 9x5 inch loaf pan with parchment paper. Use some of the butter as “glue” before lining the pan. Melt the remaining butter on the stovetop or in the microwave. Set aside to cool.
In a large mixing bowl, mash your bananas into small lumps with a fork.
Add the wet ingredients (yogurt, melted butter, beaten eggs, and vanilla extract). Mix well.
Add the dry ingredients (sugar, salt, baking soda and flour). Mix until there are no more visible white spots. Add chocolate chips or whatever add-ons you like. Mix until incorporated.

Pour the batter into your lined loaf pan and bake for about 60 minutes. The loaf should inflate with a slight crack in the middle. To check for doneness, insert a long wooden skewer in the center. If it comes out clean, you're done.
Mix together the honey and hot water in a small bowl. Brush it onto the finished loaf for a beautiful shiny finish.
Let it cool in the pan for a bit. Cut into thick slices and enjoy.
